titleInfo.title: Steamboat in the Bayou Plaquemine locks

mods.abstract: Steamboat Captain Joe in Bayou Plaquemin waiting to enter the Mississippi River. The steel locks, with a lift of fifty-five feet, were said to be the highest in the world when built in 1909.

titleInfo.title: Louisiana Sea Grant Digital Images Collection

mods.note: Butler, W.E. Down Among the Sugar Cane: The Story of Louisiana Sugar Plantations and Their Railroads. Baton Rouge, LA: Moran Publishing Corporation, 1980.
